contextId.information: The words "put our trust" are left out of this phrase. AT: "but instead, to put our trust in God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Paul and his coworkers preach the gospel with the awareness that God is watching them. AT: "we speak in the presence of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is not a letter that people engraved on stone tablets but a letter that the Spirit of the living God wrote on tablets of human hearts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: It was not written on tablets of stone, but on tablets of human hearts

contextId.information: You can supply the verb for these phrases. AT: "but we proclaim Christ Jesus as Lord, and we proclaim ourselves as your servants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: but Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your servants

contextId.information: The word "the Lord" may be supplied from the previous verses. AT: "whether we are at home with the Lord or away from the Lord" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: whether we are at home or away

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "the one whom the Lord recommends is the one of whom the Lord approves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: it is the one whom the Lord recommends

contextId.information: You can make clear the understood information. AT: "I am more a servant of Christ than they are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
